item.description:
The Time Machine (1960) Tuesday, May 8, 2012 7PM

This 1960 American science fiction film is based on the novel of the same name written by H. G. Wells in 1895. A man in Victorian England constructs a time-travelling machine which he uses to travel to the future. The film starred Rod Taylor, Alan Young and Yvette Mimieux.

Ron Mallett, Professor of Physics at Uconn, has been working on plans for a time machine. He wrote a book entitled, Time Traveler: A Scientist's Personal Mission to Make Time Travel a Reality, co-written with New York Times best-selling author Bruce B. Henderson. Currently, Spike Lee is planning to make a movie about Mallet and his book.

 

 

 

Science on Screen creatively pairs area scientists with entertaining films.   For more information about the series, go to:  http://www.realartways.org/science-on-screen.html

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Science on Screen: "The Time Machine"
